system.description:
• At 1st level, as a reaction, you may carve a bloody Rune into a creature as though painting on a canvas.

  • ??? is a master rune calligrapher, using a Rune Pool to carve Rune Designs into the flesh of others within reach of the Backpack Straps making them Rune Bearers.
  • The reach of this is dependent on your Strap length.

  • The Runes you know can be found here:

    • ??? - Rune Lord

  • These Runes bind, hinder, ward, or empower the target they’re applied to.
  • The Rune Pool cost, time, and effect of each Rune is plainly stated in the document.
    • You can't apply more than one Rune at a time on a target.
    • You roll your Rune Hunger Die against the creature you use this on, siphoning some energy back in return.
      • They roll for each Rune Pool cost of 10, rounded up.

        • As per usual, this amount cannot be reduced or blocked by any means.

  • Alternatively, you can carve Runes into objects and it’s considered a Rune Aura Trap when stated and the effect lasts 1 hour.

    • You do not Roll your Rune Hunger Die against the object, and therefore receive nothing in return.

    • Rune Aura Trap

      • The Rune’s Aura fills a 5-foot cube and no more than one Rune can be placed in the space.

      • The first time a creature occupies the aura, the Rune feeds on their life force which then triggers the trap and the Rune is destroyed in the process.

        • The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or suffer the effects of the Rune.

          • A creature can choose to auto fail the save.

          • If a creature feels something is off and goes to detect a hidden Rune, they must succeed on a Wisdom (Perception) check against your Mimic level + your Proficiency + your Rune Hunger Die.

• Rune Pool: 10

  • Lasts: Indefinite, but Rune Hunger Die are rolled at the end of their turns until used

  • Effect: The Rune Bearer gains advantage on their next Aid roll.

    • Alternatively, as a reaction, the Rune Bearer may also shout encouragement to another creature within 30 feet of them to give the other creature advantage on an ability check.

J8Cbwn36o4jrY867.name: Rune Hunger Die
J8Cbwn36o4jrY867.description:
• Each Round, if there are creatures within 5 feet of you, you must feed on at least one of them for unblockable damage dealt by your Rune Hunger Die.

  • You may also do this if anyone enters or leaves your immediate 5 foot feeding perimeter.

system.description:
• ??? ??? ? ????? ? ????????? ? ????? ??? ??????? ??????? ???????? ??? ? ?? ? ? ??????? ???? ????? ????? an unquenchable hunger for the life force of others.

    • You may choose every target within 5 feet of you to use this on, but never less than 1.

    • Each Round, if there are creatures within 5 feet of you, you must feed on at least one of them for unblockable Necrotic damage dealt by your Rune Hunger Die.

    • You may also do this if anyone enters or leaves your immediate 5 foot feeding perimeter.

• Rune Pool: 15

  • Lasts: Until they’re hit with fire.

  • Effect: The Rune Bearer becomes incendiary and bursts when struck with fire.

    • Each creature, including the Rune Bearer, and objects within 10 feet of them takes damage equal to your Rune Hunger Die in Fire damage.

• Rune Pool: 10

  • Lasts: until any within the chain rolls to save

  • Effect: The Rune Bearer is grappled by spiritual chains that emerge from the ground.

    • The Rune Bearer can make a Strength saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns to end the condition.

      • To do so, it must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against your Mimic Level + your Proficiency + Rune Hunger Die to escape.

      • Your usual advantage applies.

    • As a reaction, you may use the spiritual chains to carve the Rune into another creature within 5 feet of the first.

      • Rune Pool: 5

      • Note: You do not roll your Rune Hunger Die against that creature.

      • This can continue from the new Rune Bearer as an additional reaction and so on until any of the Rune Bearers breaks free.

      • When one Rune Bearer breaks free, they all do, so beware.

• Rune Pool: 15

  • Lasts: Until they’re hit by electrical damage.

  • Effect: The target becomes a conduit for electrical damage.

    • When they take Lightning damage, they take half the damage and become ground 0 for the ability.

      • This essentially means, if the creature who cast the lightning ability in the first place has a reach of 30, that creature then chooses a new target within 30 feet of the Conduit Rune.

• Rune Pool: 15

  • Lasts: Until they’re hit by electrical damage.

  • Effect: The target becomes a conduit for electrical damage.

    • When they take Lightning damage, they take half the damage and become ground 0 for the ability.

      • This essentially means, if the creature who cast the lightning ability in the first place has a reach of 30, that creature then chooses a new target within 30 feet of the Conduit Rune.

• Rune Pool: 10

  • Lasts: Until they’re revealed by any means.

  • Effect: You make the Rune Bearer more difficult to see.

    • Until their next turn, the target has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

      • Wisdom (Perception) made to perceive the target has disadvantage when relying on sight.

• Rune Pool: 20

  • Lasts: Until the end of their next turn

  • Effect: The Rune Bearer gains protection from aberrations, fiends, and undead.

    • Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the Rune Bearer.

    • Those creatures cannot come within 10 feet of the Rune Bearer.

      • Applies if the Rune Bearer is the ground or an object as well.

    • The Rune Bearer can’t be charmed, frightened, or possessed by these creatures.

      • If the Rune Bearer is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

    • Can be used on the ground, and ends at the end of the next round.

• Rune Pool: 10

  • Lasts: Until the end of their next turn

  • Effect: If the Rune Bearer moves further than 5 feet on their turn, you may roll your Rune Hunger Die against them.

• Rune Pool: 20

  • Lasts: Until the end of their next turn

  • Effect: The Rune Bearer gains the benefits of the protection from elemental spells.

    • They have advantage on saving throws.

    • They take half damage on a failure.

    • They take no damage on a success.

• Rune Pool: 10

  • Lasts: Until the end of their next turn

  • Effect: Roll your Rune Hunger Die and give a spiritual shield that completely absorbs the damage from whatever attempts to harm them next.

    • Note: If an attack does multiple strikes, only the damage from the first is absorbed.

      • Example: Only one magic missile out of a cluster would be absorbed.

• Rune Pool: 10

  • Lasts: Until the end of their next turn

  • Effect: Roll your Rune Hunger Die and give a spiritual shield that completely absorbs the damage from whatever attempts to harm them next.

    • Note: If an attack does multiple strikes, only the damage from the first is absorbed.

      • Example: Only one magic missile out of a cluster would be absorbed.

• If a creature picks you up, you may immediately start your turn and cause a Surprise Round for you and your party.

    • Your first action is a free action and does not count against your reactions.

• Your form is unusual, and comes with a few Advantages/Disadvantages.

    • Advantages:

      • Toss me Around

        • Immune to falling damage.

        • You are immune to the Prone condition.

      • Stomach Acid

        • Immune to acid damage, due to your stomach section literally being full of acid.

      • Itty Bitty Limited Space

        • You can fit yourself through gaps 6 inches in height, and 1 foot wide.

          • You can pull yourself through a cylinder with a 10 inch circumference.

      • Darkvision

        • You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

          • You can’t discern color in darkness, but everything is a shade of leather tan instead of the usual Darkvision gray.

      • False Appearance

        • While motionless in object form, you appear indistinguishable from an ordinary Traveler’s Pack.

        • You must spend one minute motionless before this ability takes effect.

        • You must maintain concentration during that time, as if you were casting a spell.

        • They must not have seen you as a mimic to fall for this.

    • Disadvantages:

      • What I'ma Do With That?

        • You have no hands to grip weapons, wear shields, or use items which require manipulation (spellcasting foci, wands, tools, etc.)

        • You are unable to wear armor or use shields.

• When opened, there are two chambers inside:

    • Stomach

      • Your larger pocket is filled with stomach acid and digests anything and everything put into it.

        • AKA: If someone tries to reach in there to steal from the character wearing ????, they’re going to lose the hand.

    • Greater Bag of Holding

      • The pocket itself only appears to be a few inches deep, but is a portal to a void roughly the size of a house where Matthias dwells.

        • ???? sits inside magically manipulating items ???? believes might be helpful.

          • When ???? being cheeky, ???? might simply toss up items that are clearly unhelpful to screw with those wearing ????.

            • ???? spent an eternity trapped as this bag, of course ???? going to mess around to entertain herself on occasion.

• All that time alone in the cave taught you how to fall into a state of inertness, shutting down your Insatiable Rune by dropping your Rune Pool to 0.

    • You do this as a free action and may use up any reactions you currently have remaining before you activate it.

    • This ends your ability to aid those you’re attached to in any way, including your Aura.

      • Essentially you become a regular Traveler’s Pack.

      • They may still retrieve items from you as they would any other pack.

    • You unconsciously absorb information from around you, rousing when a team member uses their action or reaction to place a hand to your Insatiable Rune.

      • Your Rune Hunger Die roll against them, even if they’ve already been rolled this round.

    • During this time, only magic can detect that you’re a Mimic.

    • This also triggers if you take damage that reduces your Rune Pool to 0.

• The Mimic Rune only hosts one creature as its primary captive, and therefore the life force absorbed from others builds up as a separate force.

    • You gather energy equal to the life force absorbed by Insatiable Rune into your Rune Pool.

activation.reactionTrigger: Something your size or larger is within reach

system.description: • As a reaction, you may adhere to a creature or object within 5 feet of you as long as the thing you’re adhering to is larger than you.

• Those who find themselves attached to you might feel your razor sharp, needle teeth penetrating their flesh, taking 1d4 piercing damage and 1d4 acid damage.

    • You reroll Rune Hunger Die against them, even if they’ve already been rolled.

activation.reactionTrigger: You're a Mimic! Swing Baby, Swing!

system.description:
• You may attack those within your Razer Straps reach for 2d4 slashing damage.

    • You reroll Rune Hunger Die against them, even if they’ve already been rolled.
